From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: sałudar

Aragonese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin salūtāre.

Verb

[edit]

saludar

  1. (transitive) to salute

References

[edit]
  • Bal Palazios, Santiago (2002), “saludar”, in Dizionario breu de a luenga aragonesa, Zaragoza, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Catalan saludar, from Latin salūtāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [sə.luˈða]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [sa.luˈðaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

saludar (first-person singular present saludo, first-person singular preterite saludí, past participle saludat)

  1. to greet
  2. to wave
  3. to salute

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of saludar (first conjugation)

References

[edit]
  • “saludar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Spanish saludar, from Latin salūtāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /saluˈdaɾ/ [sa.luˈð̞aɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: sa‧lu‧dar

Verb

[edit]

saludar (first-person singular present saludo, first-person singular preterite saludé, past participle saludado)

  1. to greet
  2. to wave

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of saludar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive saludar
gerund saludando
past participle masculine feminine
singular saludado saludada
plural saludados saludadas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
